title: Research utility pole styles by region
Add to landing page category grid
Graph-based content navigation architecture
description:
Rethink content architecture as a knowledge graph, not a taxonomy.

## The Problem
Current structure is hierarchical: Category > Country > Hints
But users need multi-directional exploration:
- Country → "What hints identify Japan?"
- Hint → "Which countries have this bollard?"
- Continent → "European license plates"
- Similarity → "Countries with plates like Germany"

## Core Entities
- Country (JP, DE, BR...)
- Continent/Region (Europe, Asia...)
- Category (bollards, plates, signs...)
- Hint (specific bollard design, plate format...)

## Relationships (edges)
- Country ∈ Continent (membership)
- Hint ∈ Category (classification)
- Hint ↔ Country (many-to-many - the core data)
- Country ~ Country (similarity via shared hints)
- Hint ~ Hint (co-occurrence in same countries)

## Navigation Patterns Needed
1. Category landing → filter by continent/country
2. Country profile → all hints for that country
3. Hint detail → all countries using it
4. "Similar to X" recommendations
5. Global search across all entities

## Technical Implications
- Unified data model with relationships
- Multiple route patterns (not just /category/item)
- Faceted search/filter across dimensions
- "Related" suggestions based on graph proximity

title: Vector embeddings for semantic similarity
description:
Use vector embeddings to compute rich similarity between countries across dimensions.

## Vision
Move beyond simple "shared hints" counting to semantic similarity:
- Image embeddings (CLIP/OpenCLIP) for visual hints (bollards, plates, signs)
- Text embeddings for language characters
- Multi-modal embeddings combining all hint types

## Use Cases

### Per-Category Similarity
- "Countries with similar bollards to Germany"
- "Countries with similar language characters to Finland"
- "Countries with similar road signs to Japan"

### Cross-Category Similarity  
- "Countries that LOOK like Germany overall" (weighted combination)
- "Most visually distinctive countries" (furthest from centroid)
- "Most commonly confused country pairs" (closest embeddings)

### Learning & Practice
- "Show me countries often confused with Japan" → focused study
- "Quiz me on distinguishing similar countries"
- "What's the ONE thing that differentiates DE from AT?"

### Reverse Image Search
- Upload a bollard photo → "This looks most like: Germany (92%), Austria (87%)"
- Paste text → "Characters suggest: Finland (95%), Estonia (72%)"

## Technical Approaches

### Image Embeddings
- CLIP/OpenCLIP for visual similarity
- Pre-compute embeddings for all hint images
- Store in vector DB or simple JSON with cosine similarity

### Text/Character Embeddings
- Character n-gram embeddings for scripts
- Or simpler: Jaccard similarity on character sets

### Hybrid Scoring
```typescript
interface SimilarityScore {
  overall: number;           // Weighted combination
  byCategory: {
    bollards: number;
    plates: number;
    signs: number;
    languages: number;
    // ...
  };
  differentiators: string[]; // "Look for X to distinguish"
}
```

## Infrastructure Options
- Client-side: Pre-computed similarity matrix (works offline)
- Edge: Cloudflare Vectorize for real-time queries
- Hybrid: Pre-compute common queries, edge for custom

## Long-term: AI-Assisted Learning
- "Explain why Germany and Austria are similar"
- "Generate a mnemonic for distinguishing Nordic countries"
- "What should I focus on to get better at Eastern Europe?"

title: Content acquisition: Scrape reference sites for categories and images
description:
Bootstrap GeoHints content by extracting structured data and images from established reference sites.

## Target Sites
1. **plonkit.net/guide** - Comprehensive guides per country
2. **geomastr.com** - Bollards, plates, signs, road lines by continent
3. **geohints.com** - Language characters, various hints

## Content Categories to Extract
- Bollards (images by country)
- License Plates (images, formats)
- Street Signs (SVGs/images by type: stops, yields, chevrons, etc.)
- Road Lines (colors, patterns by country)
- Driving Side (simple data)
- Domains (ccTLDs)
- Flags (if not using emoji)
- Utility Poles (images)
- Fuel Stations (logos, brands)

## Technical Requirements

### Scraping Approach
- Playwright/Puppeteer for JS-rendered content
- Respect robots.txt and rate limiting
- Store raw scraped data before processing
- Map to our unified data model

### Image Pipeline
- Download original images
- Convert to WEBP (quality 80-85)
- Generate multiple sizes for srcset (400w, 800w, 1200w)
- Optimize with sharp or squoosh
- Validate all images render correctly

### Qwik Image Compliance
- All images MUST use @unpic/qwik Image component
- Specify width/height to prevent CLS
- Use layout="constrained" for responsive
- Lazy load below-the-fold images

## Image Storage Decision

### Options to Evaluate

| Option | Pros | Cons |
|--------|------|------|
| Git repo | Simple, version controlled | Bloats repo, slow clones |
| Git LFS | Better for binaries | Still has size limits, LFS quota |
| Cloudflare R2 | Cheap ($0.015/GB), fast | Need to manage separately |
| Cloudflare Images | Optimized delivery, transforms | $5/mo + per-image costs |
| Vercel Blob | Native to deployment | Cost at scale |
| Public CDN folder | Simple, cacheable | No transforms, manual optimization |

### Recommendation
Evaluate R2 + public CDN for production, but start with optimized images in `/public/images/` for simplicity during development.

## Legal/Ethical Considerations
- These are educational reference materials
- Consider attribution requirements
- Avoid verbatim copying of descriptive text
- Focus on factual data (bollard designs are facts, not creative works)
- Add credits/sources page if appropriate

## Output
- Structured TypeScript data files per category
- Optimized WEBP images in consistent naming scheme
- Documentation of data sources

title: Audit: Map content structure of plonkit.net
close_reason: Audit complete - plonkit has 150+ countries, country-centric structure, harder to scrape than geomastr but more content

comments.author: kevinchen
comments.text:
# Plonkit.net Audit Complete

## Site Structure
- **Organization**: Country-centric (NOT category-centric)
- **URL Pattern**: https://www.plonkit.net/{country-slug}
- **Total Countries**: 150+ locations covered
- **Regions**: Africa, Antarctica, Oceania, South America, North America, Asia, Europe

## Content Categories Found (embedded within country guides)

### Infrastructure Categories (High Value for Scraping)
1. Bollards - Described with regional variations
2. Utility Poles - Pole types, markings, insulators, poletops
3. Road Markings - Center lines, outer lines, rumble strips
4. Signage - Street signs, road signs, highway shields
5. License Plates - Described textually with images
6. Guardrails - Colors, designs, regional variations
7. Traffic Lights - Orientation, styles
8. Bus Stops - Regional designs

### Other Categories
9. Landscape/Vegetation - Trees, crops, terrain
10. Architecture - Building styles by region
11. Language/Scripts - Writing systems
12. Coverage Metas - Camera generations, car types

## Image URL Pattern
Pattern: /images/{country-slug}/{filename}.png or .jpg

## Key Differences from geomastr.com

| Plonkit | Geomastr |
|---------|----------|
| By Country | By Category |
| /{country} | /{category}/ |
| /images/{country}/*.png | /assets/media/{category}/{country}.jpg |
| Very deep guides | Single image per country |
| 150+ countries | ~80-100 |

## Scraping Challenge
Images are embedded in country guides, not organized by category. Must parse each country page and categorize images by section context.

## Scraping Priority Recommendation
1. Bollards - Most consistent, well-documented
2. Utility Poles - High value, many regional variations
3. Road Markings - Good coverage
4. License Plates - Useful but text-heavy
5. Guardrails - Good for some countries

title: Migrate scraping infrastructure to Effect-TS
description:
## Overview
Migrate all scraping scripts in `/scripts/` to Effect-TS for improved reliability, observability, and maintainability.

## Current Scripts
- `manifest.ts` - Manifest management for tracking scraped images
- `scrape-geomastr.ts` - Web scraper for geomastr.com images
- `process-images.ts` - Image processing pipeline using Sharp
- `upload-wrangler.ts` - R2 upload via Wrangler CLI

## Benefits of Effect Migration
1. **Retry Logic** - Exponential backoff for HTTP requests and uploads
2. **Structured Error Handling** - Tagged errors with proper type tracking
3. **Concurrency Control** - Bounded parallelism for downloads/uploads
4. **Resource Management** - Proper cleanup of file handles and HTTP connections
5. **Observability** - Structured logging and telemetry via Effect's logging

## Architecture
- Services: HttpClient, FileSystem, ImageProcessor, ManifestRepo, R2Uploader
- Layers: Provide test/production implementations
- CLI: @effect/cli for typed argument parsing

## References
- Effect solutions: services-and-layers, error-handling, cli
- @effect/platform for FileSystem and HttpClient

title: Set up Effect dependencies and tsconfig
description:
## Tasks
1. Add dependencies to package.json:
   - `effect`
   - `@effect/platform`
   - `@effect/platform-node`
   - `@effect/cli`
   - `@effect/schema` (if not bundled)

2. Update tsconfig.json for Effect:
   - `"strict": true`
   - `"exactOptionalPropertyTypes": true`
   - `"moduleResolution": "bundler"` or `"NodeNext"`
   - `"target": "ES2022"` or higher

3. Create scripts/lib/ directory structure:
   ```
   scripts/
     lib/
       services/
       errors/
       schemas/
   ```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Effect imports work correctly
- [ ] TypeScript compiles without errors
- [ ] Basic Effect.runPromise works in a test file
close_reason: Effect dependencies installed: effect, @effect/platform, @effect/platform-node, @effect/cli

title: Create Effect-based HTTP client service with retry/backoff
close_reason: HttpClientService with retry/backoff working

title: Create Effect-based file system service
description:
## Overview
Wrap @effect/platform FileSystem with domain-specific operations for the scraping pipeline.

## Implementation
```typescript
import { FileSystem, Path } from "@effect/platform"
import { Context, Effect, Layer, Schema } from "effect"

class FileSystemError extends Schema.TaggedError<FileSystemError>()(
  "FileSystemError",
  { path: Schema.String, operation: Schema.String, cause: Schema.Defect }
) {}

class ScraperFileSystem extends Context.Tag("@geohints/ScraperFileSystem")<
  ScraperFileSystem,
  {
    readonly readFile: (path: string) => Effect.Effect<Uint8Array, FileSystemError>
    readonly writeFile: (path: string, data: Uint8Array) => Effect.Effect<void, FileSystemError>
    readonly ensureDir: (path: string) => Effect.Effect<void, FileSystemError>
    readonly deleteFile: (path: string) => Effect.Effect<void, FileSystemError>
    readonly exists: (path: string) => Effect.Effect<boolean>
  }
>() {}
```

## Features
- Automatic directory creation (recursive)
- Proper resource cleanup via Effect.acquireRelease
- File hash computation (SHA-256)
- Temp file management

## References
- Current fs operations scattered across all scripts
- Use @effect/platform-node for Node.js implementation
close_reason: FileSystemService with JSON/Schema support working

title: Migrate manifest.ts to Effect
description:
## Overview
Convert manifest.ts to use Effect patterns with proper Schema definitions.

## Current Functions to Migrate
- `loadManifest()` - Load JSON from disk, create if missing
- `saveManifest()` - Write JSON to disk
- `generateImageKey()` - Pure function, no change needed
- `getNextSequence()` - Pure function, no change needed
- `findByHash()` - Pure function, no change needed
- `addEntry()` - Pure function, mutates manifest
- `getEntriesByCategory()` - Pure function
- `getEntriesByCountry()` - Pure function
- `getStats()` - Pure function

## Implementation
```typescript
import { Context, Effect, Layer, Schema } from "effect"

// Schema definitions
const ManifestEntrySchema = Schema.Struct({
  source: Schema.Literal("plonkit", "geomastr", "geohints", "original"),
  originalUrl: Schema.String,
  scrapedAt: Schema.String,
  description: Schema.optional(Schema.String),
  hash: Schema.optional(Schema.String),
  processed: Schema.optional(Schema.Boolean),
  uploaded: Schema.optional(Schema.Boolean),
})

const ManifestSchema = Schema.Struct({
  version: Schema.Number,
  updatedAt: Schema.String,
  entries: Schema.Record(Schema.String, ManifestEntrySchema),
})

class ManifestRepo extends Context.Tag("@geohints/ManifestRepo")<
  ManifestRepo,
  {
    readonly load: () => Effect.Effect<Manifest, ManifestError>
    readonly save: (manifest: Manifest) => Effect.Effect<void, ManifestError>
  }
>() {}
```

## Features
- Schema validation on load
- Atomic writes (write to temp, then rename)
- Proper error types for parse/IO failures

## References
- Current: scripts/manifest.ts
- Types: scripts/types.ts

title: Migrate scrape-geomastr.ts to Effect
description:
## Overview
Convert the geomastr scraper to use Effect with proper concurrency control and retry logic.

## Current Functions to Migrate
- `fetchPage(url)` - HTTP GET with delay
- `downloadImage(url, tempPath)` - Download binary to temp file
- `scrapeCategory(category)` - Parse HTML, extract images, download each
- `scrapeAll()` - Sequential category scraping

## Implementation Highlights

### Concurrency Control
```typescript
// Use Effect.forEach with bounded concurrency
const downloadAll = Effect.forEach(
  images,
  (img) => downloadAndProcess(img),
  { concurrency: config.maxConcurrent }
)
```

### Retry with Backoff
```typescript
const retryPolicy = Schedule.exponential("500 millis").pipe(
  Schedule.compose(Schedule.recurs(3)),
  Schedule.whileInput((err) => err._tag !== "RateLimitError")
)

const fetchWithRetry = fetchPage(url).pipe(
  Effect.retry(retryPolicy)
)
```

### HTML Parsing
- Keep cheerio for HTML parsing (pure transformation)
- Wrap in Effect.try for error handling

## Error Types
- `FetchError` - HTTP request failed
- `ParseError` - HTML parsing failed
- `UnknownCountryError` - Country code mapping failed

## References
- Current: scripts/scrape-geomastr.ts
- Depends on: HTTP client service, FileSystem service, ManifestRepo

title: Migrate process-images.ts to Effect (Sharp integration)
description:
## Overview
Convert image processing pipeline to Effect with proper resource management for Sharp operations.

## Current Functions to Migrate
- `hashFile(filePath)` - SHA-256 hash of file contents
- `processImage(inputPath, outputDir, baseName)` - Generate srcset sizes
- `addImage(...)` - Full pipeline: hash check, process, update manifest
- `processAllUnprocessed()` - Batch process unprocessed entries
- `showStats()` - Display manifest statistics

## Implementation

### ImageProcessor Service
```typescript
class ImageProcessor extends Context.Tag("@geohints/ImageProcessor")<
  ImageProcessor,
  {
    readonly process: (input: ProcessInput) => Effect.Effect<ProcessedImage, ProcessingError>
    readonly resize: (input: Uint8Array, width: number) => Effect.Effect<Uint8Array, ProcessingError>
    readonly toWebp: (input: Uint8Array, quality: number) => Effect.Effect<Uint8Array, ProcessingError>
    readonly getMetadata: (input: Uint8Array) => Effect.Effect<ImageMetadata, ProcessingError>
  }
>() {}
```

### Resource Management
```typescript
// Sharp operations wrapped with proper error handling
const processWithSharp = Effect.tryPromise({
  try: () => sharp(buffer).resize({ width }).webp({ quality }).toBuffer(),
  catch: (error) => ProcessingError.make({ cause: error, operation: "resize" })
})
```

## Error Types
- `ProcessingError` - Sharp operation failed
- `HashError` - Hash computation failed
- `DuplicateImageError` - Image already exists (soft error)

## Features
- Parallel srcset generation (3 sizes)
- Memory-efficient streaming for large images
- Progress reporting via Effect.tap

## References
- Current: scripts/process-images.ts
- Sharp docs for Effect-compatible patterns
close_reason: Migrated to Effect-based ImageService with Sharp. Created process CLI command. All 1718 images converted to proper WEBP with srcset variants.

title: Migrate upload-wrangler.ts to Effect
description:
## Overview
Convert R2 upload script to Effect with proper process management and retry logic.

## Current Functions to Migrate
- `uploadFile(localPath, r2Key)` - Execute wrangler CLI command
- `uploadImageSet(category, countryCode, baseName)` - Upload all srcset sizes
- `uploadAll()` - Upload all unuploaded entries from manifest
- `uploadCategory(category)` - Upload specific category
- `resetUploadFlags()` - Reset manifest upload flags

## Implementation

### R2Uploader Service
```typescript
class R2Uploader extends Context.Tag("@geohints/R2Uploader")<
  R2Uploader,
  {
    readonly upload: (localPath: string, r2Key: string) => Effect.Effect<void, UploadError>
    readonly uploadImageSet: (params: UploadSetParams) => Effect.Effect<UploadResult, UploadError>
  }
>() {}
```

### Command Execution
```typescript
import { Command } from "@effect/platform"

const wranglerUpload = (localPath: string, r2Key: string) =>
  Command.make("pnpm", "wrangler", "r2", "object", "put", 
    `${bucket}/${r2Key}`,
    `--file=${localPath}`,
    "--content-type=image/webp",
    "--remote"
  ).pipe(
    Command.exitCode,
    Effect.flatMap((code) => 
      code === 0 
        ? Effect.void 
        : UploadError.make({ r2Key, exitCode: code })
    )
  )
```

## Error Types
- `UploadError` - Wrangler command failed
- `FileNotFoundError` - Local file missing
- `AuthError` - Wrangler not authenticated

## Features
- Parallel uploads with bounded concurrency
- Progress tracking (uploaded/failed/skipped counts)
- Atomic manifest updates after each successful upload

## References
- Current: scripts/upload-wrangler.ts
- @effect/platform Command module for process spawning

title: Add structured logging and telemetry
description:
## Overview
Add Effect's built-in logging and telemetry for observability.

## Implementation

### Logging
```typescript
import { Effect, Logger, LogLevel } from "effect"

// Structured logging throughout pipeline
const download = Effect.gen(function* () {
  yield* Effect.logInfo("Downloading image", { url, category, country })
  const result = yield* httpClient.downloadImage(url)
  yield* Effect.logDebug("Download complete", { bytes: result.length })
  return result
})

// Custom logger with JSON output
const JsonLogger = Logger.make(({ message, annotations, level, timestamp }) => ({
  level: LogLevel.label(level),
  timestamp: timestamp.toISOString(),
  message,
  ...annotations
}))
```

### Telemetry with Spans
```typescript
const processImage = Effect.fn("ImageProcessor.process")(function* (input) {
  // Automatic span creation via Effect.fn
  yield* Effect.annotateSpans({ category: input.category })
  // ... processing logic
})
```

### Metrics (Optional)
```typescript
import { Metric } from "effect"

const imagesProcessed = Metric.counter("images_processed")
const processingDuration = Metric.histogram("processing_duration_ms")
```

## Log Levels
- ERROR: Unrecoverable failures
- WARN: Recoverable issues (duplicate found, retry needed)
- INFO: Main pipeline events (started, completed, stats)
- DEBUG: Detailed operation info

## Features
- JSON-formatted logs for machine parsing
- Correlation IDs across related operations
- Configurable log level via CLI flag

## References
- Effect docs on logging and telemetry
- effect-solutions show basics

title: Add CLI with Effect Command module
description:
## Overview
Replace manual process.argv parsing with @effect/cli for typed, documented commands.

## Implementation

### Main CLI Structure
```typescript
import { Args, Command, Options } from "@effect/cli"
import { NodeContext, NodeRuntime } from "@effect/platform-node"

// Options shared across commands
const verbose = Options.boolean("verbose").pipe(Options.withAlias("v"))
const dryRun = Options.boolean("dry-run").pipe(Options.withAlias("n"))

// Subcommands
const scrape = Command.make("scrape", { category: categoryArg }, ({ category }) =>
  scrapeCategoryEffect(category)
)

const process = Command.make("process", {}, () =>
  processAllUnprocessedEffect()
)

const upload = Command.make("upload", { category: categoryOption }, ({ category }) =>
  Option.match(category, {
    onNone: () => uploadAllEffect(),
    onSome: (cat) => uploadCategoryEffect(cat)
  })
)

const stats = Command.make("stats", {}, () =>
  showStatsEffect()
)

// Root command with subcommands
const cli = Command.make("geohints-scraper").pipe(
  Command.withSubcommands([scrape, process, upload, stats])
)
```

### Example Usage
```bash
# Scrape specific category
geohints-scraper scrape bollards --verbose

# Process all images
geohints-scraper process

# Upload with dry-run
geohints-scraper upload --dry-run

# Show stats
geohints-scraper stats
```

## Features
- Automatic --help generation
- --version flag
- Tab completion support
- Typed arguments with validation
- Subcommand aliases

## References
- effect-solutions show cli
- @effect/cli documentation
